solution_line_template: The total cost of two notebooks is ${notebook_cost_per_unit} x {num_notebooks} = $<<{notebook_cost_per_unit}*{num_notebooks}={total_notebook_cost}>>{total_notebook_cost}.
The total cost of two pen ${pen_cost_per_unit} x {num_pens} = $<<{pen_cost_per_unit}*{num_pens}={total_pen_cost}>>{total_pen_cost}.
So, the total amount Rubble spent for all the stuff was ${total_notebook_cost} + ${total_pen_cost} = $<<{total_notebook_cost}+{total_pen_cost}={total_spent}>>{total_spent}.
Therefore, Rubble was left off with ${initial_money} - ${total_spent} = $<<{initial_money}-{total_spent}={money_left}>>{money_left}.
